summary: Donald A Purdy, Jr. was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He is mentioned in several payroll and certification reports from 1977 and 1978. These documents list his name, position, salary, and pay period earnings. The documents indicate he was employed by the HSCA during the period when they were actively investigating the JFK assassination.
significance: Donald A Purdy, Jr.'s significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with reinvestigating the JFK assassination. While the documents do not specify his exact role within the committee, his presence on payroll and certification reports indicates he was part of the staff involved in the investigation.
